titleproper.value: Guide to the Time Inc. <title render="italic">Architectural Forum</title> and <title render="italic">House & Home</title> Editorial Records: <lb/>Managing Editor Edgar P. Smith Files<lb/>1952-1962<lb/> <num>MS 3009-RG 12</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-11-26T21:30:50</date>

unittitle.value: Time Inc. <title render="italic">Architectural Forum</title> and <title render="italic">House & Home</title> Editorial Records: Managing Editor Edgar P. Smith Files

abstract.value: Contains Edgar P. Smith's records regarding the evaluation and possible sale of <title render="italic">Architectural Forum</title> and <title render="italic">House & Home</title>. <title render="italic">Architectural Forum</title> was a professional journal focused on design and modern architecture, and <title render="italic">House & Home</title> was a trade magazine for building and buying new houses.

p.value: Open to qualified researchers. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.

This record group should be cited as Time Inc. <title render="italic">Architectural Forum</title> and <title render="italic">House & Home</title> Records: Edgar P. Smith Files, MS 3009-RG 12, New-York Historical Society.

Huxtable, Ada Louise. "Architectural Forum Dropped." <title render="italic">New York Times</title> (New York, NY), May 28, 1964, http://www.nytimes.com/1964/05/28/architectural-forum-dropped.html?_r=0 .

Contains Edgar P. Smith's files on the evaluation of finances and possible sale of <title render="italic">Architectural Forum</title> and <title render="italic">House & Home</title> during his tenure as managing editor. Records include correspondence, budgets, memoranda, reports, and studies.

subject.value: Publishers and publishing -- New York (State)  -- New York.
